intro: Metrosideros lucida, commonly known as the flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The tree has a spreading habit with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are glossy on top and pale underneath. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. The plant also plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
